noun.description: A quantity of something, especially the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, or extent.
examples: the sport gives an enormous amount of pleasure to many people
the substance is harmless if taken in small amounts

verb.description: Come to be (the total) when added together.
examples: losses amounted to over 10 million dollars

phrases: a good marriage can withstand any amount of external pressure
I don't think there is any amount of pressure that can be exerted from Australia that's going to make the difference.
Little by little you will be renewed from within yourself and be able to withstand any amount of stress.
New Orleans gets any amount of rain and they have got a water problem.
They are unfazed by any amount of death, destruction, loss, tragedy, travesty.
origin: Middle English (as a verb): from Old French amunter, from amont upward, literally uphill, from Latin ad montem. The noun use dates from the early 18th century.
